CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: 5-13 Careful combinations of donor and acceptor units have yielded low band polymers with a band gap of 1.3 - 1.7 eV , which lead to high PCEs exceeding 7% . 14-17 A variety of good donor moieties , including oligothiophenes , 18-23 carbazole , 24 benzo[1,2-b:4,5-b′]dithiophene , 25-27 and dithienosilole , 14,28 have been demonstrated as useful for low band gap polymers ; good acceptor moieties including thieno- [3,4-b]thiophenes substituted with electron - withdrawing groups , 29-31 N-alkylthieno [3,4-c]pyrrole-4,6-dione , 25,28 benzothiadiazole , 24,32 and 2,5-bis(2-alkyl)pyrrolo [3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4-(2H,5H)-dione 33-36 have been developed. However , good acceptor moieties enabling polymers to absorb wavelengths over 800 nm remain still rare though acceptor moieties strongly affected to produce a narrow band gap. 37-40 In search of new acceptor moieties , we designed an interesting structure of N-octyl-2,7-dithia-5-azacyclopenta[a]-pentalene-4,6-dione ( DTPD ). The DTPD is a structural combination of thieno [3,4-b]thiophene and N-alkylpyrrole-2,5-dione. The thieno [3,4-b]thiophene is a particularly suitable structure to promote quinoid structures in conjugated polymers. 41-44 However , simple incorporation of the thieno- [3,4-b]thiophene units might increase the highest occupied molecular orbital ( HOMO ) level of polymers , which causes a significant loss of open - circuit voltages in PSCs. 42 Thus , it is desirable to attach electron - withdrawing groups such as ketone or ester groups and fluorine atoms. 12,15,30 Here we glued the Nalkylpyrrole-2,5-dione , a strong electron - withdrawing unit , 45 to the thieno [3,4-b]thiophene to bring down the HOMO level. Our DFT calculations , indeed , suggested that the DTPD would be a strong electron - withdrawing acceptor moiety ( Figure S1 ). 26,45 Therefore , each fractional unit in the DTPD may exert a synergetic effect to permit strong donor - acceptor electronic delocalization by the quinoid structure and to locate HOMO and lowest unoccupied molecular orbital ( LUMO ) levels of resulting low band gap polymers in a deep state when the DTPD is copolymerized with an appropriate donor moiety. Despite these promising features , to the best of our knowledge , the DTPD moiety has never been utilized to synthesize low band gap polymers for PSCs. Herein , we report synthesis and characterization of two polymers , POBDTPD and PEBDTPD , that consist of DTPD and BDT moieties substituted with octyloxy or 2-ethylhexyloxy g r o u p s , r e s p e c t i v e l y . P O B D T P D : P C 7^0 B M a n d PEBDTPD : PC 70 BM blends utilized light absorption up to 900 nm in the generation of photocurrents and showed optimal morphology and efficient exciton separation , yielding PCEs exceeding 5% . This work demonstrates that the newly designed DTPD moiety is a promising building block for high performance PSCs . The thermal properties of the polymers were examined by differential scanning calorimetry ( DSC ) and thermogravimetric analysis ( TGA ). In the DSC curve , neither polymer displayed a transition up to 300 °C ( Figure S2a,b ).

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| oligothiophenes |
| carbazole |
| benzo[1,2-b:4,5-b′]dithiophene |
| dithienosilole |
| thieno-[3,4-b]thiophenes |
| N-alkylthieno[3,4-c]pyrrole-4,6-dione |
| benzothiadiazole |
| 2,5-bis(2-alkyl)pyrrolo[3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4-(2H,5H)-dione |
| N-octyl-2,7-dithia-5-azacyclopenta[a]-pentalene-4,6-dione (DTPD) |
| BDT |
| POBDTPD |
| PEBDTPD |

Note: BDT stands for "benzothiadiazole".

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| oligothiophenes |
| carbazole |
| benzo[1,2-b:4,5-b′]dithiophene |
| dithienosilole |
| thieno-[3,4-b]thiophene |
| N-alkylthieno[3,4-c]pyrrole-4,6-dione |
| benzothiadiazole |
| N-octyl-2,7-dithia-5-azacyclopenta[a]-pentalene-4,6-dione (DTPD) |

Note: The following entities were removed from the list as they do not clearly refer to material names:

* "BDT" (should be "benzothiadiazole")
* "POBDTPD"
* "PEBDTPD"

However , good acceptor moieties enabling polymers to absorb wavelengths over 800 nm remain still rare though acceptor moieties strongly affected to produce a narrow band gap. 37-40 In search of new acceptor moieties , we designed an interesting structure of N-octyl-2,7-dithia-5-azacyclopenta[a]-pentalene-4,6-dione ( DTPD ). The DTPD is a structural combination of thieno [3,4-b]thiophene and N-alkylpyrrole-2,5-dione. The thieno [3,4-b]thiophene is a particularly suitable structure to promote quinoid structures in conjugated polymers. 41-44 However , simple incorporation of the thieno- [3,4-b]thiophene units might increase the highest occupied molecular orbital ( HOMO ) level of polymers , which causes a significant loss of open - circuit voltages in PSCs. 42 Thus , it is desirable to attach electron - withdrawing groups such as ketone or ester groups and fluorine atoms. 12,15,30 Here we glued the Nalkylpyrrole-2,5-dione , a strong electron - withdrawing unit , 45 to the thieno [3,4-b]thiophene to bring down the HOMO level. Despite these promising features , to the best of our knowledge , the DTPD moiety has never been utilized to synthesize low band gap polymers for PSCs. Herein , we report synthesis and characterization of two polymers , POBDTPD and PEBDTPD , that consist of DTPD and BDT moieties substituted with octyloxy or 2-ethylhexyloxy g r o u p s , r e s p e c t i v e l y . P O B D T P D : P C 7^0 B M a n d PEBDTPD : PC 70 BM blends utilized light absorption up to 900 nm in the generation of photocurrents and showed optimal morphology and efficient exciton separation , yielding PCEs exceeding 5% . This work demonstrates that the newly designed DTPD moiety is a promising building block for high performance PSCs . The thermal properties of the polymers were examined by differential scanning calorimetry ( DSC ) and thermogravimetric analysis ( TGA ). In the DSC curve , neither polymer displayed a transition up to 300 °C ( Figure S2a,b ).

Let's think step by step.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| band gap |
| HOMO (highest occupied molecular orbital) |
| LUMO (lowest unoccupied molecular orbital) |
| open-circuit voltage |
| donor moiety |
| acceptor moiety |
| quinoid structure |
| electron-withdrawing groups |
| ketone groups |
| ester groups |
| fluorine atoms |

| thieno[3,4-b]thiophene |
| DTPD (N-octyl-2,7-dithia-5-azacyclopenta[a]-pentalene-4,6-dione) |
| BDT (benzothiadiazole) |
| PC70BM (polycrystalline bulk material) |
| POBDTPD (polymer with DTPD and BDT moieties substituted with octyloxy or 2-ethylhexyloxy groups) |
| PEBDTPD (polymer with DTPD and BDT moieties substituted with 2-ethylhexyloxy groups) |
| DSC (differential scanning calorimetry) |
| TGA (thermogravimetric analysis) |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Property name of material" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| band gap |
| HOMO (highest occupied molecular orbital) |
| LUMO (lowest unoccupied molecular orbital) |
| open-circuit voltage |
| donor moiety |
| acceptor moiety |
| quinoid structure |
| electron-withdrawing groups |
| ketone groups |
| ester groups |
| fluorine atoms |
| N-alkylpyrrole-2,5-dione |
| thieno[3,4-b]thiophene |
| DTPD (N-octyl-2,7-dithia-5-azacyclopenta[a]-pentalene-4,6-dione) |

Note:

* "N-alkylpyrrole-2,5-dione" and "thieno[3,4-b]thiophene" are not explicitly mentioned as property names in the paragraph, but they are mentioned as components of the DTPD moiety, which is a property of the material.
* "DTPD" is a property name, but it is not explicitly mentioned as a property of the material in the paragraph. It is mentioned as a building block for high performance PSCs.
* "BDT" is not mentioned as a property name in the paragraph. It is mentioned as a component of the PC70BM material.
* "PC70BM" is not a property name, it's a material name.
* "POBDTPD" and "PEBDTPD" are not property names, they are names of specific polymers.
* "DSC" and "TGA" are not property names, they are techniques used to examine the thermal properties of materials.
